sequence.notes: Asymmetric alpha-chlorination of methyl 4-oxopentanoate to form methyl (S)-2-chloro-4-oxopentanoate, mediated by a chiral imidazolidinone auxiliary and copper(II) trifluoroacetate.

Nucleophilic addition of an organolithium reagent to a chiral aldehyde, forming a new stereocenter with apparent high diastereoselectivity and retention of the existing stereocenter. The Z-alkene stereochemistry is preserved.

E-alkene is converted to a 1,2-diol. The two newly introduced hydroxyl groups are shown with anti-relative stereochemistry in the product, which is unexpected for OsO4-mediated syn-dihydroxylation. The SMILES reflects the drawing.

Intramolecular cyclization to form a tetrahydrofuran derivative. The reaction involves multiple steps including the displacement of chloride and likely ring formation through an internal ester cyclization. The stereochemistry at two centers (C with Ph, OH; C with ester side chain) is retained, while one center (C with OH in the ring) shows inversion.
